channel.title: *NEW GAME* Rewriting the RSC client
channel.description:
I've been talking to alot of people in this RSC community and most of them are saying that the only way to acctually get a legit RSC server is to rewrite the RSC client, get new sprites, new map etc.
I started a research and found a company that is willing to rewrite the client for only $5000. So I said to myself, alright since I got the money why not invest it in something that I think could work.
But I'm still not 100% sure that this gives me the right to go offical with a game like this. If you sit on any information that could help me please post here.
If I got the right to do this, I would need a develop team. More info coming soon..

item.title: *NEW GAME* Rewriting the RSC client
item.dc:creator: @auroa auroa
item.description:
@auroa wrote:

[quote=“KO9, post:6, topic:230125”]Not if they remake the world, all sprites, textures, client and interface.

It would just be a new game…[/quote]

His words are correct :D. And you cant copyright a protocol for the dickwad who is arguing, if you are rewriting the client, i am guessing he is doing something similar to what darkquest is doing?(|But of course more extreme) You would also have to edit alot of things that actually make the game work also, and it will probably take months, maybe years to make a bugless, safe server like rsc used to be like. Look at the dq crew, when did they start this new client they have been making and look how far they are, face it gower didnt make the rsc client in 1 year lmao.

Read full topic

item.title: *NEW GAME* Rewriting the RSC client
item.dc:creator: @mapu mapu
item.description:
@mapu wrote:

I say go for it, there are 5k people who will play your game right now, and potentially 5k more people who want to play it but never have.

There is still a market for it.

item.title: *NEW GAME* Rewriting the RSC client
item.dc:creator: @slayerX slayerX
item.description:
@slayerX wrote:

[quote=“i own you21, post:20, topic:230125”][quote author=bigh51 link=topic=302888.msg2431399#msg2431399 date=1220902176]

[quote author=KO9 link=topic=302888.msg2430941#msg2430941 date=1220855303]

[quote author=bigh51 link=topic=302888.msg2430756#msg2430756 date=1220837360]

Isn’t it illegal to reverse engineer their client anyway?
[/quote]Yes.

It isn’t actually.

Legality

In the United States and many other countries, even if an artifact or process is protected by trade secrets, reverse-engineering the artifact or process is often lawful as long as it is obtained legitimately. Patents, on the other hand, need a public disclosure of an invention, and therefore patented items do not necessarily have to be reverse engineered to be studied. One common motivation of reverse engineers is to determine whether a competitor’s product contains patent infringements or copyright infringements.

Reverse engineering software or hardware systems which is done for the purposes of interoperability (for example, to support undocumented file formats or undocumented hardware peripherals), is mostly believed to be legal, though patent owners often contest this and attempt to stifle any reverse engineering of their products for any reason.

“…[W]here disassembly is the only way to gain access to the ideas and functional elements embodied in a copyrighted computer program and where there is a legitimate reason for seeking such access, disassembly is a fair use of the copyrighted work, as a matter of law.”[10]

Soruce: http://www.wikipedia.org/wiki/Reverse_engineering
[/quote]It is actually. When you registered on rs and clicked agree, one of the terms that you have to agree to to register is you may not reverse-engineer the client.
[/quote] then say you never played rs and only played rs p servers[/quote]

yea, but they keep records of i.p.s and would actually go the distance just to prove your lying under oath and track your i.p. down to your location when signed up, thus putting you behind bars even if the court ruling was innocent.

Read full topic

Yup, but the UK patent office states that reverse engineering is legal REGARDLESS of any T&C

item.title: *NEW GAME* Rewriting the RSC client
item.dc:creator: @system system
item.description:
@system wrote:

I am not so sure about the so called “protocol”; whether it can be copyrighted, or not. I think I have even heard somewhere that this “protocol” is something used by alot of different programs just for the sake of efficiency (the algorithm used). I might be wrong, however. Anyhow, I believe the biggest problem would be that these server-sources have in one or another way been involved with reverse-engineering of the client, that is, in fact Jagex’s.

There are one way, though, with which you can get around copyright infringement. But this involves two different teams. The first team must examine the system, and create a specification covering all to be added. When this is done, the specification must be granted by a lawyer, who checks whether it is legitimate, or not (does not use copyrighted material). If granted, the other team (who must not have any connection with the first team) will implement the system according to the specification provided. This method is called “The Clean Room Design”.

Just a side-note:
I don’t really think a totally new game trying to “mirror” RSC would be a great idea, unless it would actually mirror it. By this, I mean, re-making everything would make this a totally new game. When it comes to new games, I think, for it to be successful (as RSC was), you have to come up with something new and original. Today, the most games uses alot better graphics, and this is almost essential. RSC uses such “bad”, but yet nice graphics (nice and/or fun graphics according to my own opinion) because this was a problem back then (when it was created). Not alot of people had high internet-connection speed back then, and this would drastically decrease the servers capabilities of holding “high” amounts of players (if the graphics was better). Also, the server was most likely written in Java, which was not that good and/or fast back then…

I also guess the graphics was that “bad” compared to others, because Andrew was “somewhat” new to 3D-programming… I might be wrong. But that is what I think.

Read full topic

item.title: *NEW GAME* Rewriting the RSC client
item.dc:creator: @KO9 KO9
item.description:
@KO9 wrote:

[quote=“Ian, post:12, topic:230125”][quote author=KO9 link=topic=302888.msg2429613#msg2429613 date=1220794599]

You can’t copyright a protocol
[/quote]The protocol is still runescapes and by using the protocol of theres whats custom to the Rsc servers is the fact of it all the rsc client is copyrighted

I can’t quite figure out what you’re trying to say. But like I said, you cannot copyright a protocol. The client itself is copyright - the images, sounds et al.

However you cannot copyright how a client communicates with a server (protocol), this is why people in the open source community are able to write F/OSS for Exchange/Windows filesharing (samba) etc, without breaking the law.

So you think that editing every single last object. sprite and landscape in rs u edit that and u want get sued its quite funny mate because rs can sue you for still using all there shit if u researched a bit on the 317 servers and ppl got done for it because of the protocols i.e www.frugooscape.net[/quote]

I’m not going to argue with you, your posts aren’t even coherent.

OP - If you re-write the client and it doesn’t bare resemblence to the current one - different interface, vhange all the images and sounds and possibly some NPC names and how everything in the world is layed out then you should be fine.

Read full topic

item.title: *NEW GAME* Rewriting the RSC client
item.dc:creator: @shyne shyne
item.description:
@shyne wrote:

I’ve been talking to alot of people in this RSC community and most of them are saying that the only way to acctually get a legit RSC server is to rewrite the RSC client, get new sprites, new map etc.

I started a research and found a company that is willing to rewrite the client for only $5000.
So I said to myself, alright since I got the money why not invest it in something that I think could work.

But I’m still not 100% sure that this gives me the right to go offical with a game like this. If you sit on any information that could help me please post here.

If I got the right to do this, I would need a develop team.
More info coming soon…

Read full topic
